page.title: 03Livestock
page.content: In this area the farmers tend to concentrate on{cattle}and{pigs.}The cattle farmers have begun to produce a lot more{meat}than milk, because the E.E.C. quotas have limited the amount of milk that they are allowed to produce. In order to increase and improve the meat production, other breeds , such as{Charolais}and {Limousin,}have been mixed with the usual{Friesian}and{Hereford}strains. The cattle are grazed outdoors in summer, but are kept in deep litter accomodation in winter, when they are fed on hay and silage produced locally,and bought-in concentrates. They are slaughtered after 18 months or 2 years. Pig breeders concentrate on{Large {Whites}because they produce good quality pork and bacon.
